Although Eric Schmidt said that he was happy with Google's decision to stop co-operating with China over censorship in March last year, he added: Over time I would hope, especially in my new role with more of an external focus, that I can try to get more of Google, appropriately and within our policies, into China. It was revealed earlier this month that fifty-five-year-old Eric Schmidt would make way as chief executive for Larry Page , 37, who co-founded Google with Sergey Brin .
